etymologies: late 17th century; earliest use found in Randle Holme (1627–1700), herald painter. Apparently from French recercelé (although this is first attested slightly later: 1690), specifically use of †recercelé curly, curled, use as adjective of past participle of recerceler to curl from re- + cercel ringlet

definitions: Of a cross: having the ends of the limbs curling into divergent spirals.
